Recorder_RMF_Future_Rec_Switch_Off_Box_Inline_282

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_283

Reboot the box after removing lastid.dat file from recdbser folder and reboot.All the recordings  should be available in box using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3. Delete the lastid.dat file from /tmp/mnt/diska3/persistent/dvr/recdbser/

4.reboot the box

5.check whether all the recordings are still there in the box

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether all the recordings are still there in the box

High

RecorderAgent

Recorder_RMF_Delete_Lastid_And_Check_Recordings_Inline_284

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_285

Recorder should cancel all the three recordings when an update schedule message is received with Full Schedule as true using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule 1 hot recording and 2 future recording using legacy

4.Schedule another hot recording with full schedule value as true

5. Check whether all the first 3 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether all the first 3 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

Recorder_RMF_Verify_FullSchedule_True_ThreeRec_Inline_286

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_287

Recorder should cancel all the four recordings when an update schedule message is received with Full Schedule as true using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

3.Schedule 1 hot recording and 3 future recording using legacy

4.Schedule another hot recording with full schedule value as true

5. Check whether all the first 4 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 2 Check whether all the first 4 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Verify_FullSchedule_True_MultipleRec_Legacy_287

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_288

Recorder should cancel all the four recordings when an update schedule message is received with Full Schedule as true using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule 1 hot recording and 3 future recording using inline

4.Schedule another hot recording with full schedule value as true

5. Check whether all the first 4 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether all the first 4 recordings are cancelled with error USER_STOP

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Verify_FullSchedule_True_MultipleRec_Inline_288

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_289

Long poll server should send HTTP 400 when server is enabled with HTTP 400 error and after clearing the error legacy recording should get complete

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure long poll server with error 400 and reboot the box

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording

4.Check ocapri log for error code 400 and connection retry requests

5. Clear the lp server error and wait for the re-connection and also for the recording to get completed

6.Check the status of recording , it should be complete

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the error codes are available in ocapri log and also check the recording status.

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

4.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Check_HTTP_400_LPServer_Inline_290

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_291

RWS server should send HTTP 400 when the server is enabled with HTTP 400 error and also after retry recorder should send error code RDK-10028

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS server with error 400

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording

4.Check ocapri log for error code 400 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS server error 400

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the error codes are available in ocapri log

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

4.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Check_HTTP_400_RWSServer_291

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_292

RWS server should send HTTP 400 when the server is enabled with HTTP 400 error and also during boot up after retry recorder should send error code RDK-10028

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS server and RWS secure server with error 400 and reboot the box

3. Immeadiately after reboot schedule a 2 min legacy recording

4.Check ocapri log for error code 400 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS server and RWS secure server error 400

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the error codes are available in ocapri log

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

4.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_293

RWS status server should send HTTP 400 when the server is enabled with HTTP 400 error and also after retry recorder should send error code RDK-10028 using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status server with error 400

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Check ocapri log and application log for error code 400 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS status server error 400

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

2. Schedule a 1 min recording and wait for the recording to complete

3.Configure RWS status server and RWS secure status server with error 400 and reboot the box

4.Check ocapri log and application log for error code 400 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS status server and RWS secure status server error 400

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS server and RWS secure server with error 500 and reboot the box

3. Immeadiately after reboot schedule a 2 min legacy recording

4.Check ocapri log for error code 500 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS server and RWS secure server error 500

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the error codes are available in ocapri log

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

4.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Check_HTTP_500_RWSServer_Bootup_306

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_307

RWS status server should send HTTP 500 when the server is enabled with HTTP 500 error and also after retry recorder should send error code RDK-10028 using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status server with error 500

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Check ocapri log and application log for error code 500 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS status server error 500

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_309

RWS status server should send HTTP 500 when the server is enabled with HTTP 500 error and also during full sync after retry recorder should send error code RDK-10028

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Schedule a 1 min recording and wait for the recording to complete

3.Configure RWS status server and RWS secure status server with error 500 and reboot the box

4.Check ocapri log and application log for error code 500 and connection retry requests

5. Also check the ocapri log for RDK error code RDK-10028 for connection lost with RWS server.

6.Clear the RWS status server and RWS secure status server error 500

Recorder_RMF_Check_HTTP_500_RWSStatus_Fullsync_309

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_310

Long poll server should send HTTP 401 when server is enabled with HTTP 401 error and after clearing the error legacy recording should get complete

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure long poll server with error 401 and reboot the box

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording

4.Check ocapri log for error code 401 and connection retry requests

5. Clear the lp server error and wait for the re-connection and also for the recording to get completed

6.Check the status of recording , it should be complete

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the error codes are available in ocapri log and also check the recording status.

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

4.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Check_HTTP_430_RWSStatus_Fullsync_319

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_320

Check whether recordings durations are extending when back to back recordings happens on different channels using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule 3 recordings of 6 minutes duration on different channels with start time as 0 , 6 and 12 minutes

4.After 30 sec ,extend the durations of each recordings by 8 minutes

5. Wait for the recordings to complete

6. Check whether the expected durations of recordings are extended and also check the actual duration of each recoridngs

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recordings are extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Schedule_Backto_Back_Recordings_AndExtend_Duration_Legacy_320

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_321

Check whether recordings durations are extending when back to back recordings happens on different channels using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule 3 recordings of 6 minutes duration on different channels with start time as 0 , 6 and 12 minutes

4.After 30 sec , extend the durations of each recordings by 8 minutes

5. Wait for the recordings to complete

6. Check whether the expected durations of recordings are extended and also check the actual duration of each recoridngs

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recordings are extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Schedule_Backto_Back_Recordings_AndExtend_Duration_Inline_321

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_322

To extend the duration of an inprogress recording using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a recording of 2 minutes duration using legacy

4.After 30 sec , extend the duration of recording by 3 minutes using updateSchedule message

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Inprogress_Recording_Extend_Duration_Legacy_322

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_323

To extend the duration of an inprogress recording using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a recording of 2 minutes duration using inline

4.After 30 sec , extend the duration of recording by 3 minutes using updateSchedule message

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Inprogress_Recording_Extend_Duration_Inline_323

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_324

To extend the duration of a future recording using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a a future recording of 2 minutes duration with start time 1 minute using legacy

4.Before recording starts extend the duration of recording by 3 minutes using updateSchedule message

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_FutureRecording_Extend_Duration_Legacy_324

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_325

To extend the duration of a future recording using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a a future recording of 2 minutes duration with start time 1 minute using inline

4.Before recording starts extend the duration of recording by 3 minutes using updateSchedule message

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_FutureRecording_Extend_Duration_Inline_325

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_326

To extend the duration of an inprogress recording before reboot using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a recording of 2 minutes duration using legacy

4.Extend the duration of recording by 8 minutes using updateSchedule message

5. Reboot the box and Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_FutureRecording_Extend_Duration_Before_Reboot_Inline_329

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_330

To extend the duration of an inprogress recording after reboot using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a recording of 11 minutes duration using legacy

4.Reboot the box

5. Extend the duration of recording by 13 minutes using updateSchedule message and Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Recorder_RMF_FutureRecording_Extend_Duration_After_Reboot_Inline_333

        

CT_Recoder_DVR_Protocol_334

To update duration of a future recording upon receiving updateRecordings message using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a future recording of 1 minute duration with start time 1 minute using legacy

4. Before recording starts update the recording duration to 2 minutes using updateRecordings mesage

5.Check whether the expected duration of recording is NOT extended and also check the actual duration of recording is NOT changed.

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check whether fields are NOT updated for the specified recording Id.

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_UpdateDuration_FutureRecording_Inline_335

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_336

To extend the duration of an inprogress recording multiple times using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a recording of 2 minutes duration using legacy

4.After 30 sec , extend the duration of recording by 3 minutes using updateSchedule message using legacy

5.Again after 30 sec , extend the duration of recording by 5 minutes using updateSchedule message using legacy

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Extend_Durationof_Completed_Recording_Inline_341

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_342

Recorder should not extend the duration of an Incomplete recording due to power interrupt using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 11minutes duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete partially and reboot the box

5. After recording end time got expired extend the duration to 13 minutes

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is NOT extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is NOT extended and recorded properly

Recorder_RMF_Extend_Durationof_InComplete_Recording_Inline_343

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_344

To check recordings value persistency after moving to P0 priority using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot P4 recording of 1 minute duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete

5. Update the recording priority to P0

6. Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording values are like expected

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording should not have any undesirable values

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Check_Recording_Value_Persistency_After_Delete_Legacy_344

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_345

To check recordings value persistency after moving to P0 priority using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot P4 recording of 1 minute duration using inline

4.Wait for the recording to complete

5. Update the recording priority to P0

6. Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording values are like expected

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording should not have any undesirable values

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_Check_Recording_Value_Persistency_After_Delete_Inline_345

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_346

To check recording value persistency after moving to priority P0 followed by a priority restore and reboot using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot P4 recording of 1 minute duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete

5. Update the recording priority to P0 and restore to P4

6. Reboot the box Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording values are like expected

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording should not have any undesirable values

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Check_Recording_Value_Persistency_After_Delete_Restore_Reboot_Inline_347

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_348

Recording details should be there after deleting metadata unless there is a reboot happened in the box using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 2 minute duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete

5. Delete the meta data of the recording including backup file

6. Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

4.Wait for the recording to complete

Recorder_RMF_Check_RecStatus_After_Delete_Metadata_Inline_349

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_350

Recording should continue without any issues after corrupting meta data using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 3 minute duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete partailly.

5. Delete the meta data of the recording (Do NOT delete backup file)

6. Wait for the recording to complete and Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

5. Delete the meta data of the recording (Do NOT delete backup file)

Recorder_RMF_Corrupt_RecMetadata_Inprogress_Recording_Inline_351

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_352

To check the status of a future recording which has an expired end time using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule a future recording with an expired end time using legacy mechanism and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.getrecordings message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

5. Verify the completed recording has Erased status

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check the state of current recordings

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Check_StatusOf_FutureRecWith_Expired_Endtime_Legacy_352

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_353

Positive

Recorder_RMF_Check_StatusOf_FutureRecWith_Expired_Endtime_Inline_353

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_354

To extend an inprogress recording with end time in past using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a future recording of 5 minutes duration with start time 2 minutes using legacy

4.After 30 sec , extend the duration of recording to a past end time using updateSchedule message

5. Wait for the recording to complete

6. Check whether the expected duration of recording is NOT extended and also check the actual duration of recoridng.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is NOT extended and recorded properly

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Extend_Future_Recording_EndtimeIn_Past_Inline_357

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_358

To check recordings by rebooting the box when that recording is in StartedWithError using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule a future recording of long duration with using legacy mechanism and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.Reboot the box before recording starts and wait for the recording to complete

5.getrecordings message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

6. Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.recording status should be InComplete

7.Check whether the content field of corresponding recording have multiple segements

8.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check the state of current recordings

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot P4 recording of 2 minute duration using legacy

4. Update the delete priority to P0 when the recording is in progress

5. Wait for the recording to complete and Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Recorder_RMF_InprogressRec_Reboot_Update_Restore_Deletion_Prioirty_Legacy_364

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_365

To update and restore the deletion priority of an in progress recording which is incomplete due to POWER_INTERRUPTION using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot P4 recording of 8 minute duration using inline

4. Reboot the box when recording is in progress

5. Update the delete priority to P0 and restore the delete priority to P4 when the recording is in progress.

6. Wait for the recording to complete and Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Check the priority is updated to P4

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_InprogressRec_Reboot_Update_Restore_Deletion_Prioirty_Inline_365

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_366

Recorder should send the full sync details for an updateSchedule message if the last full sync was suppressed with server connection issue using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording using legacy and wait for the recording to complete

4. Configure RWS Status server with HTTP 404 error and Reboot the box

5. Wait for full sync to fail and check RDK-10028 error code is getting.

6. Schedule a hot recording using legacy with bad ocap and wait for the connection fall back in RWS status server then check RDK-10028 error code.

7.Wait for 10 minutes

8.Clear the RWS Status server HTTP 404 error and wait for RWS Status server connection re-establishment

9.Send an updateSchedule message using legacy and check whether reocrder responds to this updateSchedule message with full sync details

10.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Check the full sync is happening or not

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_clearOcapri_log

3.TestMgr_Recorder_checkOcapri_log

Recorder_RMF_Extend_Recording_With_RequestedStart_Inline_375

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_376

To extend a recording and schedule a future recording with same ocap using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3. Schedule a hot recording with 2 minute duration and a future recording of 1 minute duration with 2 minute start time on same channel using legacy

4. After 30 seconds extend the hot recording to 3 minutes using legacy

5.Wait for the recording to complete and check whether the recording is NOT have any undesirable values

6.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Check whether the recording is got completed successfully or NOT

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Hot_Future_Rec_Same_OcapId_Inline_383

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_384

Recordings with missing blobs should report as Status=Erased, Error=ORPHANED in the next full sync using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording of 2 minutes using legacy

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.Wait for the recording to complete.

5.Check the status of the scheduled recording, it should be complete. 9. 6.Delete the blobs of previously completed recording. (Delete .bak files also)

7.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the one more current recording of 2 minutes using legacy

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

8.Wait for the recording to complete.

9.Reboot STB.

10.noUpdate schedule message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

11.Check the status of first recording, it should be ERASED and error should be set to ORPHANED.

12.Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.

13.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Rec_Erased_Delete_Blobs_Legacy_384

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_385

Recordings with missing blobs should report as Status=Erased, Error=ORPHANED in the next full sync using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording of 2 minutes using inline

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.Wait for the recording to complete.

5.Check the status of the scheduled recording, it should be complete. 9. 6.Delete the blobs of previously completed recording. (Delete .bak files also)

7.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the one more current recording of 2 minutes using inline

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

8.Wait for the recording to complete.

9.Reboot STB.

10.noUpdate schedule message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

11.Check the status of first recording, it should be ERASED and error should be set to ORPHANED.

12.Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.

13.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Rec_Erased_Delete_Blobs_Inline_385

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_386

Recordings with missing XML's should report as Status=Erased, Error=ORPHANED in the next full sync using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording of 2 minutes using legacy

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.Wait for the recording to complete.

5.Check the status of the scheduled recording, it should be complete. 9. 6.Delete the XML's of previously completed recording. (Delete .bak files also)

7.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the one more current recording of 2 minutes using legacy

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

8.Wait for the recording to complete.

9.Reboot STB.

10.noUpdate schedule message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

11.Check the status of first recording, it should be ERASED and error should be set to ORPHANED.

12.Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.

13.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Rec_Erased_Delete_XML_Legacy_386

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_387

Recordings with missing XML's should report as Status=Erased, Error=ORPHANED in the next full sync using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording of 2 minutes using inline

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

9.Reboot STB.

10.noUpdate schedule message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

Recorder_RMF_Rec_Erased_Delete_XML_Inline_387

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_388

Future recording with missing standard blob should

resume after reboot and report as Status=INCOMPLETE ,Error=STARTED_LATE using legacy. It should not be reported as ORPHANED.

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule a future recording of 13 minutes duration with 40 seconds as start time using legacy

and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

4.Delete the Blob's of previously schedule future recording. (Dont Delete .bak files)

5.Reboot the box before recording starts

6.Wait for the recording to complete.

7.getRecordings message will be send to TDK Recorder Simulator server once STB is up to get the list of recordings.

8.Check the status of first recording, it should be INCOMPLETE and error should be set to STARTED_LATE.

9.Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.

10.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Future_Rec_Delete_Blobs_Legacy_388

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_389

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Future_Rec_Delete_Blobs_Inline_389

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_390

Check whether the Failed recording details using legacy are getting synced with RWS or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Recording_Failed_Legacy_390

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_391

Check whether the Failed recording details using inline are getting synced with RWS or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule a 1 min inline recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Recording_Failed_Inline_391

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_392

After reboot check whether the Failed recording details using legacy are getting synced with RWS  or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule a 1 min legacy recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen and reboot the box.

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_393

After reboot check whether the Failed recording details using inline are getting synced with RWS  or not  when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule a 1 min inline recording with an invalid ocap id

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen and reboot the box.

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Recording_Failed_Reboot_Inline_393

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_394

Check whether the Multiple Failed recording details using legacy are getting synced with RWS  or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. In five seconds gap , Schedule two 1 min legacy recording with invalid ocap id's

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status for both the recordings after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Multiple_Recording_Failed_Legacy_394

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_395

Check whether the Multiple Failed recording details using inline are getting synced with RWS  or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. In five seconds gap , Schedule two 1 min inline recordings with invalid ocap id's

4.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

5. Clear the RWS status server error 404

6.Check whether Recorder has send the FAILED status for both the recordings after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Multiple_Recording_Failed_Reboot_Inline_397

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_398

Check whether the Erased recording details using legacy are getting synced with RWS or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule a future recording of 1 minute duration with 2minutes start time using legacy.

4. Schedule another hot recording with fullSchedule as true using legacy

5.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

6. Clear the RWS status server error 404

7.Check whether Recorder has send the ERASED status after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

8.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Positive

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule two future recordings of 1 minute duration with 2minutes start time using inline

4. Schedule another hot recording with fullSchedule as true using inline

5.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen

6. Clear the RWS status server error 404

7.Check whether Recorder has send the ERASED status for both the recording after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

8.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

 

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Multiple_Recording_Erased_Inline_403

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_404

After reboot check whether the Multiple Erased recording details using legacy are getting synced with RWS or not when the server is up after reconnecting

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule two future recordings of 1 minute duration with 2minutes start time using legacy.

4. Schedule another hot recording with fullSchedule as true using legacy

5.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen and reboot the box

6. Clear the RWS status server error 404

7.Check whether Recorder has send the ERASED status for both the recording after reconnecting to RWS Status Server

8.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available as expected

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2. Configure RWS status servers with error 404

3. Schedule two future recordings of 1 minute duration with 2minutes start time using inline

4. Schedule another hot recording with fullSchedule as true using inline

5.Wait for 30 seconds for connection retry requests to happen and reboot the box

Recorder_RMF_HTTP_404_RWSStatus_Multiple_Recording_Erased_Reboot_Inline_405

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_406

Recording should continue without any issues after corrupting it's blobs using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 5 minute duration using legacy

4.Wait for the recording to complete partailly.

5. Delete the blobs of the recording (Do NOT delete backup file)

6. Wait for the recording to complete and Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Inprogress_Rec_Delete_XML_Inline_409

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_410

Recording which is corrupted and with first segment duration less than five seconds should report as STARTED_LATE using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,"FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL" and "FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1. TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 7 minute duration with 30 seconds start time using legacy

4.Wait for the 31 seconds and delete the Meta data of the recording (Do NOT delete backup file)

5.Immeadiately reboot the box and wait for the recording to complete

6.Check whether the recording error is STARTED_LATE when first segmet is less than five seconds otherwise it should be POWER_INTERRUPTION

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

 

Checkpoint 2 Recording details should be available

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

2.TestMgr_Recorder_ExecuteCmd

Recorder_RMF_Recording_Corrupt_Resume_StartedLate_Legacy_410

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_411

2. TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Schedule a hot recording of 7 minute duration with 30 seconds start time using inline

4.Wait for the recording to complete partially and delete the Meta data of the recording (Do NOT delete backup file)

5.Immeadiately reboot the box and wait for the recording to complete

Recorder_RMF_Inprogress_Rec_Delete_XML_Reboot_Inline_417

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_418

To check whether multiple Source ID change for a recording in the schedule update is getting reflected or not using legacy

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,""FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL"" and ""FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL"" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Send a future schedule for two recordings with same start time and with same source id using legacy

4.Immediately after that using update schedule msg with fullschedule as false send a different but valid source id change for one of the recordings using legacy

5.Again update the source id with a valid one using legacy

6.Both recordings should record successfully.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check the state of current recording

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Update_SourceID_Multiple_Legacy_418

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_419

To check whether multiple Source ID change for a recording in the schedule update is getting reflected or not using inline

Positive

XG1

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,""FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL"" and ""FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL"" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.Send a future schedule for two recordings with same start time and with same source id using inline

4.Immediately after that using update schedule msg with fullschedule as false send a different but valid source id change for one of the recordings using inline.

5.Again update the source id with a valid one using inline.

6.Both recordings should record successfully.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check the state of current recording

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Update_SourceID_Multiple_Inline_419

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_420

Getrecordings response should sent the pending status for recordings which are yet to start using legacy

Positive

XG1/Emu-hyb

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,""FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL"" and ""FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL"" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

Json Interface

Json Interface- source id, duration recording_id, start_time.

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording with 1 minute duration and 3 minute start time using legacy and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

5.Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

6. Status of the Json response from Recorder to TDK Recorder Simulator server getting extracted by TM.

7.Depends on the result of above step RecorderAgent sends SUCCESS or FAILURE to TM.

Checkpoint 1 Acknowledgement status from the DVRSimulator.

Checkpoint 2 Get the list of recordings to check whether fields are updated for the specified recording Id.

High

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Future_Rec_Getrecordings_Pending_Legacy_420

        

CT_Recorder_DVR_Protocol_421

Getrecordings response should sent the pending status for recordings which are yet to start using inline

Positive

XG1/Emu-hyb

 

1. rmfStreamer executable should be running.

2. Device time should be in current time of UTC.

3. Two files should be created in the name of “stt_received” and “stage4” in “/tmp” path of device.

4. In rmfconfig.ini file the parameters “FEATURE.LONGPOLL.URL”,""FEATURE.RWS.GET.URL"" and ""FEATURE.RWS.POST.URL"" should be pointing to DVRSimulator

1.TM loads RecorderAgent via the test agent.

2.TM gets an source_id from the streaming details page of the FW and sends it to RecorderAgent to generate request url.

3.RecorderAgent / Python lib interface will frame the json message to schedule the current recording with 1 minute duration and 3 minute start time using inline and send to TDK Recorder Simulator server which is present in TM.

5.Using getRecordings message retrieve the recording details and check the recording details are there.

RecorderAgent

1.TestMgr_Recorder_SendRequest

Recorder_RMF_Future_Rec_Getrecordings_Pending_Inline_421
